channel.title: [Delta] Change Port Button In Client (For Multiple Worlds)
channel.description:
I've tried this for about an hour now, and I haven't been able to get it working. I tried setting it so that when you click the button, the portNumber variable changes, and that variable is used for connecting to the worl. I have port 5555 set as World 1 and port 43594 set for World 2. I got it reading from the variable correctly, it connected to port 0. However, It wouldn't change it when I clicked the button.
Any suggestions on how to get this, or a different system, working?
Thanks in advance - The Web Guy.

item.title: [Delta] Change Port Button In Client (For Multiple Worlds)
item.dc:creator: @Ambokile Ambokile
item.description:
@Ambokile wrote:

runescape sucks:

Maybe because it is private? Unless the button is handled within the same class as the port number. Try making it public

If it wasn’t working due to publicity reasons then he’d get a compilation error on the portNum line.

Read full topic
item.source: [Delta] Change Port Button In Client (For Multiple Worlds)

item.title: [Delta] Change Port Button In Client (For Multiple Worlds)
item.dc:creator: @The_Web_Guy The Web Guy
item.description:
@The_Web_Guy wrote:

runescape sucks:

Maybe because it is private? Unless the button is handled within the same class as the port number. Try making it public

set it to

public static int portNumber = 0;

Still didn’t want to work.

In my main() method I have:

For the button I have…

if(anInt833 == 3) { portNumber = 5555; int j1 = c / 2; int i2 = c1 / 2 + 50; aClass30_Sub2_Sub1_Sub2_967.method361(j1 - 73, 16083, i2 - 20); aClass30_Sub2_Sub1_Sub4_1272.method382(0x33CCFF, j1, anInt939, "@whi@Back", i2 + 5, true); }

It didn’t give any errors, but it still didn’t work. Thanks!

Read full topic

item.title: [Delta] Change Port Button In Client (For Multiple Worlds)
item.dc:creator: @The_Web_Guy The Web Guy
item.description:
@The_Web_Guy wrote:

runescape sucks:

Is the port a final int?

I had portNumber defined like so:

public int portNumber = 0;

That threw errors with static/non-static so I changed it to…

private static int portNumber = 0;

That got rid of the errors but my system still wont change the port number.

Read full topic
